scenarioDescription:
The tau Boo Exoplanetary System


Overview

tau Boo is a star with 1.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.43 times its radius. It is located 51.05 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

tau Boo is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the tau Boo system


tau Boo b

tau Boo b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory, in 2015-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of tau Boo b is 1892.100 times the mass of Earth. The radius of tau Boo b is 12.800 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, tau Boo b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system tau Boo, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
name: tau Boo - System With 1 Exoplanet
